subject: Re: [junit] Extend the report mechanism of Junit
msgSnippet: Dominik, In your JUnit test cases, you can write the sql statements to System.out. When you use the Ant JUnit task with the XML renderer, the output is nicely
messageBody:
Dominik,

In your JUnit test cases, you can write the sql
statements to System.out.
When you use the Ant JUnit task with the XML renderer,
the output is nicely captured in the XML output file.

You can create a style sheet similar to Ant
JUnitReport style sheets that writes this data to your
report.

Regards, Jan

--- "dominik.dary" <dominik.dary@...> wrote:

> Hello List,
>
> i want to test dynamic generated sql with dbunit.
> This is no problem
> and it works.
>
> I want to add to the created report a text with the
> expected and the
> generated SQL.
>
> Has someone an idea, where i can start reading?
>
> thanks
>
> Dome
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
